TopicTitle: I love this game for times like these

Articles.Content:
Sunrise over Kerbin at the core of my Orbital Researcher, in a near perfect circular orbit (Ap 88.4k, Pe 84.4k, 0.1m/s more and I would've made a perfect circle)

Honestly such a pretty game.

Sunrise from orbit is always a good sight. Personally I find the game a little bland visually, but then that's because I have to have the graphics turned down. On a good PC with some visual mods though it can look really great.

Wonder if we'll ever get proper looking eclipses? I recall discussion that Unity has issues with actually letting the Mun shadow Kerbin, but it couldn't be that hard to fake by dimming the light levels when an eclipse is on surely?

Wonder if we'll ever get proper looking eclipses? I recall discussion that Unity has issues with actually letting the Mun shadow Kerbin, but it couldn't be that hard to fake by dimming the light levels when an eclipse is on surely?

oh lord imagine an eclipse while in orbit during sunrise, a rare but amazing combination

oh lord imagine an eclipse while in orbit during sunrise, a rare but amazing combination

I had one of those once! The eclipsed sun broke over the horizon just as the docking ports finally met between my lander and the transit vehicle that took it out to Duna.

That mission ended up stranding three kerbals on the surface of Duna AND crashing the transit vehicle into Ike, so I guess eclipse sunrises are hardly a good-luck charm (or maybe that was when I had only been playing for a couple weeks and was a huge noob ). I think I a have the screenshots somewhere, but that was a lot of versions ago.
The light effects are amazing however the terrain lacks big time.

The light effects are amazing however the terrain lacks big time.

https://fbcdn-sphotos-f-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xap1/t31.0-8/1492352_10152047575316725_6160695703035435625_o.jpg

I assume that's laythe. How can the terrain lack when that's the whole point of the moon? (water, few islands)

Jool rising as seen from Laythe orbit is the most beautiful sight in the game, IMO. Nice shot of it, Tripzter.

I also wish there were proper eclipses and that moon shadows appeared on the parent planet (same thing I guess). As I understand it that's a Unity limitation, but hopefully someone clever will figure out a way around it.
